uniol.apt.analysis.separation

Class FirableSequences

  • java.lang.Object
    • uniol.apt.analysis.separation.FirableSequences

  • public class FirableSequences
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides functionality with firable sequences which are needed by separation. Note: This class controls k different nets. So if a transition should be fired the class checks which net is in the position to execute the transition. If there is more than one net which can fire this class will save two or more ways -- one way contains the situation if first possible net was fired, the next way the next possible net... When the next transition should be fired all saved ways have to be checked and maybe there will come more ways. This class avoids "double" ways -- see example for hashmap.
    Author:
    Daniel

      • isFiringSequenceValid

        public boolean isFiringSequenceValid(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> firingSequence)
        Checks if a single firing sequence is valid for weakly check. Note: Order in weakly check does not matter so we allow using transition from "future" which can be in "preset" after firing other transitions. Here we check if in this sequence are transitions of "future" are used. [t1, used, t2] - t1 not used, used is in future (after t1 fired) [used, used, t2] - t2 is after used, everything ok.
        Parameters:
        firingSequence - Firing sequence to check
        Returns:
        Is a valid weakly firing sequence?

      • isThereAValidFiringSequence

        public boolean isThereAValidFiringSequence()
        Checks a whole situation if there is a valid situation. Note: There can more than one way to get with a firing sequence to a state one must be valid (or) All k states have to be valid (and) If there is more than one state -- one must be valid (or)
        Returns:
        Valid firing sequence found?

      • fire

        public boolean fire(java.lang.String wantedFire,
                    boolean checkStrongly)
        This is the "main" method of this class. Just tell this function which transition should be fired and if you check strongly or weakly separable.
        Parameters:
        wantedFire - Name of the transition which should be fired
        checkStrongly - Strongly or weakly check?
        Returns:
        true: transition can be fired false: transition can not be fired.

                                                                             boolean checkStrongly)
        This method executes a transition.
        Parameters:

      • checkIfWantedFireIsPossible

        public static boolean checkIfWantedFireIsPossible(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> possibleFiringSequence,
